content.text:
# 2016 Outer Critics Circle Awards

| venue = Sardi's
}}
The 2016 Outer Critics Circle Awards winners were announced on May 7, 2016, recognizing excellence in Broadway and Off-Broadway productions during the 2015–16 season. Nominations were announced on May 9, 2016, with American Psycho and She Loves Me receiving the most nominations with 8 each. Bright Star and On Your Feet! followed with 7 nominations, and the Off-Broadway production of Dear Evan Hansen received 6 nominations. For plays, Eclipsed and Long Day’s Journey Into Night led the field with five nominations each.
Roundabout Theatre Company's revival of She Loves Me won the most awards of the night, with four including Outstanding Revival of a Musical. It was followed by ''Long Day's Journey Into Night, another Roundabout production, with three wins, including Outstanding Revival of a Play. Bright Star, Dear Evan Hansen and American Psycho'' won two awards each.
Awards and nominations
Award nominations were announced on April 19, 2016, with the winners announced on May 9, 2016, with the winners ceremony on May 26, 2016 at Sardi's.
Apart from She Loves Me and ''Long Day's Journey Into Night in the revival categories, Bright Star won Outstanding New Broadway Musical and The Humans by Stephen Karam won Outstanding New Broadway Play. The Christians by Lucas Hnath won Outstanding New Off-Broadway Play and Dear Evan Hansen won Outstanding New Off-Broadway Musical. The John Gassner Award winner was Marco Ramirez for The Royale.
